newsitem.title: USA: COKE ENTERPRISES SEES DILUTION FROM BUYS.
newsitem.headline: COKE ENTERPRISES SEES DILUTION FROM BUYS.

text.p: Coca-Cola Enterprises Inc said Thursday that it expects dilution from its acquisition of Coca-Cola Co's interest in Coke New York and Coke Canada to be about $0.02 a share in the third quarter and $0.03 a share in the fourth quarter of 1997.
Coca-Cola Enterprises said it expects that the acquisition will be dilutive to 1998 results by slightly more than $0.05 a share.

In a press release, Coke Enterprises said it has completed its acquisition of Coca-Cola' 49 percent interest in Coca-Cola Bottling Co of New York Inc and 48 percent interest in Coca-Cola Beverages Ltd, or Coke Canada.

Coca-Cola Enterprises also reported that it expects third quarter noncash selling, delivery, and administrative expenses related to certain performance-based stock compensation plans to exceed current expectations by about $35 million, or $0.05 a share.

The company also said that the British government has decreased the corporate tax rate to 31 percent from 33 percent, which will result in a third quarter 1997 tax benefit of about $58 million, or $0.15 a share.
